intro: Conyza thermarum, commonly known as the desert fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is an annual herb that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish to white composite flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss through transpiration. Conyza thermarum is also known for its rapid growth cycle, allowing it to thrive in disturbed or degraded habitats.
